Update to bring into line.
Fixed line termination problems.
Fixed line termination problems and aligned source with coding conventions.
Updated and corrected the documentation.
Updated build and run instructions.
Updated doc
Fixed bug with pow() reported by Stephane Bailliey
Updated example to reflect bug fix in MathTool.
Adjusted to coding conventions.
Updated struts application examples to latest Struts 1.0.1
Removed outdated Struts from 'simple' example. It's not used here.
Moved jakarta-servlet-api-4.jar from WEB-INF/lib to WEB-INF/build-lib so that it is not in the classpath during run time. Adjusted build.xml. This fixes the problem reported by Mark Whelan.
Removed jakarta-servlet-api-4.jar. It's not needed here and may lead to problems with some servlet containers, as reported by Mark Whelan.
Checked in version 0.6 of velstruts tools. API was completely redesigned. Added reference documentation for the tools.
Upgraded to DVSL 0.42.
Added site.dvsl for print version.
Adapted README to latest changes.
Moved .tlds to the place where they belong.
Added documentation menu file.
Adapted example build.xml to latest changes.
Patched several typos and little inefficiencies per feedback of Nathan Bubna.
Redesigned view and struts packages. Added a lot of documentation. Upgraded to latest version of various third party software packages.
Corrected @author tags in class header JavaDoc.
Bumped the version number for addition of I18N view functionality.
Noted addition of I18N support.
Allows for transparent content negotiation in a manner mimicking Apache httpd's MultiViews.  Example usage from a template would be something like the following:

Added package tools. This is intended to host various reusable context tools. Currently hosted tools are DateTool, MathTool, RequestParser and ToolLoader. All tools are optimized to be used with an auto-loading toolbox manager and come with documentation for the template designers. A documentation snapshot is online at: http://www.teamup.com/jakarta-velocity-tools/docs/vellibrary.html
Broadened interface of get(String key, ArrayList args) to get(String key, List args) to handle a wider variety of List implementations (it's not only Velocity code which may be calling this method).
Updated documentation for get(String, List) interface change.
o Improve JavaDoc.
o Renamed getInstance() back to init() to denote what the method does, and added a getInstance() method (temporarily) which does naught but call init() and return a reference to itself.

Following suggestion from Gabriel Sidler <sidler@teamup.ch>, made this context tool thread-safe (and as a side effect, immutible).  Removed destroy() and renamd init() to a new ctor overload which takes a ViewContext parameter.
Change project names are discussed on list: VelTools => Velocity Tools VelServlet => VelocityServlet VelLibrary => VelocityLibrary VelStruts => VelocityStruts
Modified VelocityViewServlet to load configuration using method loadConfiguration of VelocityServlet. Adjusted examples.
Fix to get rid of gump error "cannot find docs dir"
Fixed clean target  (file not found error)
Modified clean target to clean JAR as well
Modified clean target to clean clean.l
Modified VelStruts LinkTool such that it encodes the session ID into the returned URL if cookies are not supported by the web client.
Updated documentation of LinkTool to reflect the added URI encoding support.
Replaced the term "context tool" by "view tool" in the documentation and source.
Updated to latest DVSL 0.43

Created new 'all' target to build entire project, including all subprojects. See README in root dir for the new very simple build process. It is still possible to build subprojects individually. Super 'all' target calls 'all' targets of subprojects to do its job.

Reorganized and simplified documentation and generation thereof: - Simplified navigation and organization of documentation - Removed absolute links - Added printer-friendly versions of docs that are automatically generated and linked - Draft at: http://www.teamup.com/jakarta-velocity-tools/docs/index.html
Modified build scripts such that they work properly if source is checked out with the 'prune' option. (feedback from Tim Colsen)
Added some new sections to the VelocityStruts user guide. Structured content.
Fixed some non-critical error messages when generating the docs.
Fixed some formatting problems (Thanks, Dan)
Fixed bug: If session was null, application scope attributes could not be accessed. (Thanks to Tom Dunstan for the report)
Fixed constructor of DateTool. (Thanks to claude@savoirweb.com for the bug report)
Fixed the use of deprecated 'contextkey' element. (Thanks to claude@savoirweb.com for the bug report)
Modified VelocityViewServlet.handleRequest() method so that it now can handle being called from RequestDispatcher.include() (Thanks to Jeff Schnitzer for the patch)
Redesigned handling of view tools (contribution by Nathan Bubna)

Fixed application example in view package: - Updated toolbox.xml to latest version - Removed velocity-tools-view-*.jar from CVS. This library is now   automatically added when the package is build. This way, the   example will alway be up to date. - Revised instructions to build the package and get the example   running.
Minor fixes/cleanups.
Updated DateTool with latest version contributed by Nathan Bubna.
Moved all shared libraries from the subprojects up to the central project repository. This prevents having multiple copies of the same library in CVS. (makes downloads smaller, eases maintenance)
Fixed minor JavaDoc problem.
Fixed minor JavaDoc problems.

Improved build process. There is now a "master" build script in the root dir that builds everything, including all subprojects, documentation, example applications, etc. The "master" build script calls build scripts of each sub- project to do it job. Tested build with JDK1.3.1 and JDK 1.4.0. Tested examples with Tomcat and Resin. This should make it easier for people to get up and started. Adapted README files to the changes.
Fixed build process such that it works also if the project is checked out with the prune option.
Fixed build process such that it works also if the project is checked out with the prune option.

Improved version contributed by Nathan Bubna. Changes are: -de-staticized the parsing methods -implemented ViewTool so it can be conveniently used as a view tool -added an alternate constructor for convenience in non-template situations -changed getNumber (and thereby it's dependents) to catch NFE's and return null instead

Commited lasted version of ParameterParser contributed by Nathan Bubna. Changes are: - adds a get(String) convenience method per Claude's suggestion - factors all number parsing into one protected method to allow subclasses to easily override it and provide more advanced parsing as needed (this is a need i have)
Expanded Velocity/Struts example application "Address Editor" by an example that shows how to deals with indexed form properties (i.e. multiple form parameters that are submitted with the same name).

Refactoring of LinkTool  - drastically improve extensibility  - push struts dependencies out to org.apache.velocity.tools.struts.StrutsLinkTool  - move base class to org.apache.velocity.tools.view.tools.LinkTool  - rename setAbsolute() to setRelative() to avoid confusion with setURI()    (setAbsolute() was never a great name and doesn't make sense w/o juxtaposition to setAction() and setForward()

* src/java/org/apache/velocity/tools/generic/DateTool.java   getDateFormat(int, int, Locale, TimeZone): Sun JDK 1.4.2 warns   against using a "return" statement in a "finally" block.  I assume   that this is because any exception which and put you into the   "finally" block in the first place is subsequently discarded by the   "return".  Be more explicit about this behavior by catching and   suppressing any RuntimeException, and returning any DateFormat   instance we've procured so far.  This mirrors previous behavior.   Here's the JDK 1.4 warning message for reference:

VELTOOLS-56 - patch from Christopher Schultz 1. Catch UnsupportedEncodingException instead of generic Exception when creating InputStreamReader in acquireReader. 2. Move HTTP status code check and potential exception throw earlier in acquireReader method, so we fail as fast as possible. 3. Remove potentially dangerous non-threadsafe "isAbsoluteUrl" member. 4. Add resource cleanup in these cases:     - In acquireString (for absolute URLs), close Reader in new finally block.     - In acquireReader, close InputStream and call HttpURLConnection.disconnect in catch blocks     - In acquireReader, wrap InputStreamReader in new SafeClosingHttpURLConnectionReader, which will call HttpURLConnection.disconnect when the Reader is closed.
